Description: Fragment of handle-plate and handle of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on handle plate, black-figure decoration consisting of panther to left (head and most of tail missing) with added red on neck, belly, rib, haunch, and paws; incised blob rosette and blob as filling ornament; black, some fired red, around edge of plate, on underside and on handle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 100, no. A149, pl. LXX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.004) (Phase 1)
